definitions: phenomena of the physical world including plants, animals, and landscapes
basic or inherent features and characteristics of something
particular class or category of things sharing common features
examples: We spent the weekend hiking through nature's beautiful landscapes
The documentary explores nature in its most pristine environments
It's in her nature to help others whenever she can
The aggressive nature of the disease requires immediate treatment
What is the nature of your complaint against the company?
Questions of this nature require careful legal consideration

definitions: the digit zero or complete absence of quantity or value
state of coming to nothing or complete failure of plans
examples: All their efforts came to naught when funding was withdrawn
The score stood at naught to three at halftime
Their ambitions were brought to naught by unforeseen circumstances
Years of planning went for naught after the market crash

definitions: feeling of sickness with inclination to vomit from illness or disgust
examples: Morning sickness caused severe nausea during her first trimester
The chemotherapy treatments often resulted in persistent nausea and fatigue

definitions: central part of a church building extending from entrance to chancel
central hub of a wheel where spokes meet and attach
examples: The wedding procession walked slowly down the cathedral's long nave
Sunlight streamed through stained glass windows illuminating the nave
The wooden nave of the wagon wheel needed urgent repair
Spokes radiated outward from the strong metal nave

definitions: small hollow or protrusion in center of abdomen where umbilical cord was attached
examples: The baby's navel healed perfectly after the umbilical cord fell off
She wore a jeweled ring in her pierced navel

definitions: process of planning and following a route especially for ships, aircraft, or vehicles
system for moving between different pages or sections of a website or application
examples: Modern navigation relies heavily on GPS satellite technology
The captain studied navigation charts before setting sail
The website's navigation menu makes finding information remarkably simple
Poor navigation design frustrates users trying to complete purchases

definitions: person who directs the route or course of a ship, aircraft, or vehicle
early web browser software developed by Netscape Communications
examples: The navigator plotted their course using stars and compass readings
Aircraft navigators ensure planes follow designated flight paths
Netscape Navigator dominated web browsing before Internet Explorer's rise
Many developers still remember coding for Navigator compatibility issues

definitions: branch of armed forces conducting military operations at sea
dark blue color resembling naval uniform color
examples: She served in the navy for twenty years before retiring
The navy deployed three destroyers to patrol international waters
He wore a navy suit to the formal business meeting
The school uniform requires navy blue trousers and white shirts

definitions: vote against a motion or proposal in formal proceedings
old-fashioned or literary way of saying no, often for emphasis
examples: The motion failed with fifteen yeas and twenty nays
Several senators changed their votes from nay to yea
Nay, I shall not abandon my principles for mere convenience
Will you surrender? Nay, we fight to the end!

definitions: member of the National Socialist German Workers' Party that ruled Germany 1933-1945
person who is fanatically dedicated to or seeks to control specified activity
examples: Nazi war criminals were prosecuted at the Nuremberg trials
The museum documents Nazi persecution during the Holocaust
Don't be such a grammar nazi about casual text messages
The parking nazi gave me a ticket one minute after expiration

definitions: interstellar cloud of dust and gases visible as luminous patches in space
cloudy spot on the cornea causing defective vision
examples: The Orion Nebula is visible through small telescopes
Stars form within the dense regions of stellar nebulae
The ophthalmologist diagnosed a nebula affecting her left eye
Corneal nebulae can result from severe eye infections

definitions: something that is needed or required for a particular purpose or situation
examples: We packed only the bare necessaries for our camping trip
Food and shelter are necessaries that everyone deserves access to

definitions: state or fact of being required or indispensable for achieving something
situation enforcing a particular course of action through urgent need
examples: Clean water is a necessity for human survival
The necessity of regular exercise becomes clearer with age
Financial necessity forced him to take a second job
They acted out of necessity rather than choice

definitions: part of body connecting head to shoulders containing throat and spine
narrow part of an object such as a bottle or instrument
narrow strip of land or woods extending into water or between areas
examples: She wore a gold chain around her slender neck
The giraffe's long neck helps it reach high branches
Pour the wine carefully through the bottle's narrow neck
He adjusted the guitar by tightening the neck screws
They built their cabin on a wooded neck overlooking the lake
The neck of land connects the peninsula to the mainland

definitions: ornamental chain or string of beads worn around the neck as decoration
examples: She inherited her grandmother's pearl necklace
The diamond necklace sparkled under the ballroom lights

definitions: edge or shape of a garment opening at or near the neck area
examples: The dress featured an elegant V-shaped neckline
She preferred high necklines for professional settings

definitions: strip of cloth worn around neck under shirt collar, tied in front
examples: He loosened his necktie after the long business meeting
The company dress code requires men to wear neckties

definitions: sweet liquid produced by plants to attract pollinating insects and birds
delicious drink, especially in mythology the drink of the gods
examples: Bees collect nectar from flowers to produce honey
Hummingbirds feed primarily on flower nectar
The fresh mango juice tasted like nectar after the long hike
In Greek mythology, nectar granted immortality to the gods

definitions: thing that is wanted or required for life or achieving goals
circumstances in which something is necessary, or requiring help
examples: Basic human needs include food, water, and shelter
The project addresses the educational needs of rural communities
Families in need receive assistance from local charities
Times of need reveal who your true friends are

definitions: thin pointed metal pin used for sewing or knitting with thread
hollow pointed instrument for injections or drawing fluids
thin pointer on a dial or compass indicating measurements
thin pointed leaf typical of pine and fir trees
examples: She threaded the needle to mend the torn fabric
Grandmother's needlework required various sizes of needles
The nurse prepared the needle for the vaccination
Diabetics often use insulin needles multiple times daily
The compass needle pointed steadily north
The speedometer needle climbed past sixty miles per hour
Pine needles covered the forest floor
Evergreen needles stay green throughout winter months

definitions: art or practice of sewing or embroidery requiring needles and thread
examples: Her exquisite needlework decorated pillows and wall hangings
Victorian ladies often spent afternoons practicing needlework

definitions: people lacking basic necessities or financial resources requiring assistance
examples: The charity provides winter coats for the needy
Programs for the needy include food banks and shelters

definitions: action of denying or contradicting something as false or nonexistent
statement or word expressing denial, contradiction, or refusal
examples: His negation of the allegations convinced no one
The philosopher examined the negation of existence itself
In grammar, 'not' serves as the primary negation
Double negation can create confusion in logical arguments

definitions: photographic image with reversed light and dark areas from which prints are made
drawback or unfavorable aspect of something being considered
electrical charge carried by electrons, opposite of positive charge
examples: The photographer developed negatives in the darkroom
Digital cameras eliminated the need for film negatives
We should consider the negatives before making this investment
The proposal's negatives outweigh its potential benefits
The battery's negative terminal connects to the black cable
Electrons carry a negative electrical charge

definitions: tendency to be negative or pessimistic in attitude, expressing criticism or pessimism
examples: Constant negativity in the workplace decreased team morale
She tried to overcome her negativity through meditation

definitions: state of being uncared for or failure to provide proper care or attention
examples: Years of neglect left the historic building in ruins
Child neglect constitutes a serious form of abuse

definitions: failure to take proper care in doing something, especially legally required care
examples: The doctor faced charges of medical negligence
Gross negligence caused the preventable workplace accident

definitions: formal discussion aimed at reaching an agreement between parties with different interests
examples: Contract negotiations lasted several months before reaching agreement
Successful negotiation requires understanding both parties' needs

definitions: person who conducts negotiations on behalf of others to reach agreements
examples: The union hired an experienced negotiator for contract talks
Skilled negotiators understand the importance of compromise

definitions: person living near or next door to the speaker or person referenced
examples: Our new neighbors invited us over for dinner
Good neighbors respect each other's property boundaries

definitions: district or community within a town or city where people live
examples: The neighborhood organized a summer block party
House prices vary significantly between different neighborhoods

definitions: person living near or next door to the speaker or person referenced
examples: My neighbour offered to water my plants while away
Good neighbours make for peaceful communities

definitions: district or community within a town or city where people live
examples: The neighbourhood watch program reduced local crime
Children played safely in this quiet neighbourhood

definitions: revival of classical Greek and Roman styles in art, architecture, and literature beginning in mid-18th century
examples: Neoclassicism influenced architecture throughout Europe and America
The museum's neoclassicism collection features works by David

definitions: person advocating aggressive foreign policy and promotion of democracy abroad while maintaining traditional values domestically
examples: Neoconservatives strongly supported military intervention
The neoconservative movement gained influence during the 1980s

definitions: person supporting revival of 19th-century free-market economic policies with reduced government spending
examples: Neoliberals advocate for privatization of state enterprises
Critics argue neoliberals ignore social welfare concerns

definitions: political approach favoring free-market capitalism, deregulation, and reduction in government spending
examples: Neoliberalism shaped economic policies throughout the 1990s
Critics blame neoliberalism for increasing income inequality

definitions: newly coined word or expression that may be in process of entering common use
examples: 'Selfie' started as a neologism before entering dictionaries
Technical fields constantly produce neologisms for new concepts

definitions: inert gaseous element used in illuminated signs and fluorescent lights
very bright fluorescent color like that produced by neon lights
examples: Neon signs illuminate the Las Vegas strip
The noble gas neon glows orange-red when electrically charged
She wore a neon pink jacket to the 80s party
Neon colors dominated fashion trends that summer

definitions: person who is new to a subject, skill, or belief, especially religious novice
examples: The neophyte struggled with basic programming concepts
Buddhist neophytes undergo years of training

definitions: son of one's brother or sister, or of one's brother-in-law or sister-in-law
examples: His nephew graduated from medical school last year
She treats her nephew like her own son

definitions: practice of showing favoritism toward relatives in business or political appointments
examples: The company's nepotism policy prohibits hiring immediate family
Nepotism undermined merit-based promotion systems

definitions: unfashionable person often preoccupied with intellectual or technical pursuits
person extremely interested in and knowledgeable about particular subjects
examples: The computer nerd fixed everyone's technical problems
Being called a nerd bothered him in high school
She's a total history nerd who knows every battle date
Comic book nerds gathered at the annual convention

definitions: fiber or bundle transmitting impulses between brain and body parts
steadiness and courage in dangerous or difficult situations
audacious behavior or impudent boldness
examples: The pinched nerve caused shooting pain down her arm
Damage to optical nerves can result in vision loss
It took nerve to speak against the powerful corporation
She lost her nerve moments before the performance
He had the nerve to ask for a raise after arriving late
What nerve, cutting in line like that!

definitions: structure built by birds or other animals for laying eggs and sheltering young
comfortable or cozy place of refuge or resting
set of similar objects fitting inside one another
examples: Robins built a nest in the oak tree
The eagle's nest perched high on the cliff
She created a cozy reading nest in the attic
Their mountain cabin became a weekend nest
The Russian nesting dolls fit perfectly together
We bought a nest of mixing bowls

definitions: young bird that has not yet left the nest or learned to fly
examples: The mother bird fed worms to her hungry nestlings
Three nestlings chirped loudly for their parents

definitions: material made of string or rope woven together with spaces between
mesh barrier used in sports like tennis or soccer
amount remaining after deductions or expenses
system of interconnected computers or broadcasting stations
examples: Fishermen repaired their nets before dawn
The safety net prevented serious injuries
The tennis ball barely cleared the net
The soccer ball hit the back of the net
His net income after taxes was disappointing
The company's net profit increased this quarter
The radio net broadcasts emergency information
Their computer net connects multiple office locations

definitions: ball game similar to basketball played by two teams of seven players
examples: Netball remains popular in Commonwealth countries
She played netball throughout her school years

definitions: imaginary subterranean world of the dead in various mythologies and religions
examples: Greek myths describe Hades ruling the netherworld
The hero's journey took him through the netherworld

definitions: material consisting of open mesh made by knotting or weaving cord or thread
examples: Mosquito netting protected sleepers from insect bites
The cargo was secured with heavy-duty netting
